messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Addressed to you Bob
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/25/02 10:26:26 PM, Dnowens@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/25/02 10:26:26 PM, Dnowens@... writes:

<< If you want your post to be
only "for" certain people, or you only want certain people to reply to you
don't send it to the list, send it privately. >>

I don't want anything private. The tone of the other seemed harrassing, and
if I start gettng harrassing e-mail in private because of having posted on
this list, that's not right or good.

But I too would like to note that it's a big list and we're writing to the
list, yet often comments ARE in direct response to others. Denying it
doesn't change it.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Addressed to you Bob
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/25/02 10:58:29 PM Central Daylight Time, rsale515@cs.com ... Bob, This is addressed to you. This is the second time you have replied to a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/25/02 10:58:29 PM Central Daylight Time, rsale515@...
writes:


>
>
>
>
>
> In a message dated 8/25/2002 3:32:23 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
> westen@... writes:
> > Interesting statement Bob - let me think about it, okay?...Especially the
> > last part - un-American - I'm not American anyway! lol! ..Leionie
>
> Leonie,
>
> This wasn't addressed to you as if I disagreed with what you were saying,
> nor
> was anything in that reply posted with you in mind. I appreciated what you
> were getting at. Also, by "support and encouraging the victim," I meant
> monetarily -- buying their products. I meant nothing about not giving moral
> support and encouragement to victims, as well we should.
>
>

Bob,
This is addressed to you. This is the second time you have replied to a
poster on this list by stating that one of your posts wasn't addressed to
them. When you post on the list your post is assumed to be addressing
EVERYONE on the list. And if you include someone's name (like you did
Sandra's) in a post then it is doubly assumed that not only is the post for
everyone, it is for the person mentioned as well. Regardless, if you post,
anyone, including Leoine, is allowed to reply. If you want your post to be
only "for" certain people, or you only want certain people to reply to you
don't send it to the list, send it privately.
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
